llm_response.response_text:
Sure! Imagine you have a really big box of LEGO bricks. Each brick can be either red or blue, and you want to build something cool with them. In regular computers, it’s like having a helper that can only work with one LEGO brick at a time—first it picks a red brick, then a blue one, and keeps going one after the other.

Now, quantum computing is like having a magical helper who can work with many LEGO bricks at the same time! Instead of just choosing
